most_active_tickets.title: Getting an error of Route not found error

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Desktop App Errors on Startup
common_issues.description: Users are reporting errors and unexpected behavior with the Pieces OS desktop app on Windows, particularly during startup or after background updates.  Issues include 'Route not found' errors when accessing the Pieces OS endpoint and non-dismissable overlay messages requiring a system restart. Further investigation and troubleshooting steps are needed to address these problems.

related_issues.title: Getting an error of Route not found error
related_issues.text:
Getting an error of Route not found error
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The problem "route not found" appears whenever I attempt to access the pieces os endpoint on port 39300.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4f8961a-afa1-401d-82b5-cc2ead804b9f)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User Raju-git20 created an issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* The bot provided helpful resources like related issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.

**Problems Identified:**

* Specific details about the user's issue are not provided.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The bot offered assistance and indicated a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being reviewed by the Pieces team. 
* No further updates are available at this time.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's issue could be related to one of the listed similar issues. 
* The user can explore the provided resources for more information.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version

**Key Points:**

* User @ThemePark reported an issue with being unable to launch the Pieces Windows Desktop application.
* The conversation was triaged by a support bot and assigned to a team member.
*  @mack-at-pieces requested further information about the user's Windows version and installed Pieces components.
* @ThemePark responded with the following information:
    * Windows version: 10
    * Installed Pieces components: Suite, OS, and Desktop
* No solution was identified or implemented within the conversation excerpt provided.

**Current Status:**

* The issue remains unresolved based on the provided conversation. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests that @mack-at-pieces likely planned to investigate further based on the information provided by @ThemePark.

**Outcome:**

* The outcome of the issue is unknown based on the provided conversation.

recommendations: **Prioritize bug fixes related to the Pieces OS desktop app on Windows, especially startup errors and 'Route not found' issues.**
**Investigate and address the non-dismissable overlay message bug, as it requires users to restart their system.**
**Improve communication around background updates and provide clearer instructions or options for users in case of errors.**
**Review and update the documentation and support resources related to the Pieces OS endpoint and port 39300.**
